thread.title: Funeral Mass on Monday for New Orleans chef Paul Prudhomme
thread.title_full: Funeral Mass on Monday for New Orleans chef Paul Prudhomme - FOX 8 WVUE New Orleans News, Weather, Sports, Social

author: cbs8
title: Funeral Mass on Monday for New Orleans chef Paul Prudhomme
text:
NEW ORLEANS (AP) - Chef Paul Prudhomme, who brought Louisiana's rural Cajun cooking to the forefront of American cuisine, will be remembered at a funeral Mass on Monday in St. Louis Cathedral.
Prudhomme died Thursday after a brief illness. He was 75.
He had no formal training and was the first American-born chef hired by elegant Commander's Palace. He stirred up a nationwide appetite for Cajun food by serving gumbo, jambalaya and other dishes once largely unknown outside Louisiana.
He left Commander's to open K-Paul's, a casual spot named for himself and his wife Kay Prudhomme, who died in 1993.
He is survived by wife Lori Bennett Prudhomme, brother Eli Prudhomme, and numerous nieces, nephews, grandnieces and grandnephews.
